request.description:
### Query a User Database

This endpoint allows you to make a POST request to query a specific database containing user data.

#### Request URL

The request URL is in the following format `/db/query/{testDb}`, where:

- **{testDb}**: The database to query (ie: `favourite`)
    

#### Request Body

- **filter** (object) - Specifies the filter criteria for the query. Matches the [PouchDB filter syntax](https://pouchdb.com/api.html#query_index).
    
- **options** (object) - Specifies the additional query options. Matches the \[PouchDB options syntax\]([https://pouchdb.com/api.html#query_index](https://pouchdb.com/api.html#query_index)).
    
    - **sort** (array) - Specifies the sorting criteria for the query.
        
    - **limit** (number) - Limits the number of results to be returned.
        
    - **skip** (number) - Specifies the number of results to skip.
        

Example:

``` json
{
  "filter": {
    "sourceApplication": "https://youtube.com/"
  },
  "sort": [
    {
      "_id": "desc"
    }
  ],
  "limit": 5,
  "skip": 0
}

 ```

#### Response

- **Status**: 200
    
- **Content-Type**: application/json
    
- **items** (array) - Contains the result items
    
- **limit** (integer) - Results per page
    
- **skip** (integer) - How many results to skip
    
- **dbCount** (integer) - Total records in the database (ignoring any filter)

request.description:
### Fetch a User Database Record

This endpoint allows you to make a GET request to fetch a specific database record containing user data.

The request should include the database name (`favourite` in this example) and the record ID (`google-114389302261538986945-xskZ50giJkw` in this example) in the URL path.

#### Request URL

The request URL is in the following format `/db/get/{testDb}/{recordId}`, where:

- **{testDb}**: The database to query (ie: `favourite`)
    
- **{recordId}**: The database record to fetch (ie: `google-114389302261538986945-xskZ50giJkw`)
    

### Request Body

This request does not require a request body.

### Headers

- **permissions**: Specify the permissions for the database that is being access. ie: `read=owner,write=owner`. You can typically leave this blank as the default permissions are configured to work for all private databases. See the `Fetch User Profile` example of a request that specifies custom database permissions.
    
- **key**: Private key or seed phrase of the Verida Network account being accessed
    

### Response Body

- **Status**: 200
    
- **Content-Type**: application/json
    
- **item** (object) - Contains the result item, if found
    

### Error Responses

If the requested database record is not found, the response will have a status code of 404 with an empty body.

If there is a server error, the response will have a status code of 5xx with a body containing a JSON object with an `error` message attribute.

request.description:
### Watch a User Database

This endpoint allows you to make a POST request to watch a specific database containing user data. Any new (or modified) database records are returned in the stream.

This is not a typical HTTP request, it uses `EventSource` to stream the database changes.

#### Request URL

The request URL is in the following format `/db/watch/{testDb}`, where:

- **{testDb}**: The database to query (ie: `favourite`)
    

#### Request Body

- **options** (object) - Specifies the additional query options. Matches the \[PouchDB options syntax for `changes`\]([https://pouchdb.com/api.html#changes](https://pouchdb.com/api.html#changes)).
    
    - **sort** (array) - Specifies the sorting criteria for the query.
        
    - **limit** (number) - Limits the number of results to be returned.
        
    - **skip** (number) - Specifies the number of results to skip.
        

Example:

``` json
{
  "options": {
    "descending": true
  }
}

 ```

#### Response

- **Status**: 200
    
- **Content-Type**: application/json
    
- **type** (string) - Type of event response. One of the following:
    
    - `record`: Full database record that has been inserted or modified
        
    - `complete`: Change log has been cancelled and is now complete
        
    - `error`: Error has occurred
        
- **value** (any) - Response value, which depends on the response `type`:
    
    - `record`: Object containing the inserted or modified database record
        
    - `complete`: Empty
        
    - `error`: String containing the error message

### Query a User Datastore

This endpoint allows you to make a POST request to query a specific datastore containing user data.

A datastore is a database that is guaranteed to match a specific schema.

#### Request URL

The request URL is in the following format `/ds/query/{testDsEncoded}`, where:

- **{testDsEncoded}**: Base64 encoded URL of the datastore schema (ie: `https://common.schemas.verida.io/social/chat/group/v0.1.0/schema.json` is encoded to `aHR0cHM6Ly9jb21tb24uc2NoZW1hcy52ZXJpZGEuaW8vc29jaWFsL2NoYXQvZ3JvdXAvdjAuMS4wL3NjaGVtYS5qc29u`).
    

#### Request Body

- **filter** (object) - Specifies the filter criteria for the query. Matches the [PouchDB filter syntax](https://pouchdb.com/api.html#query_index).
    
- **options** (object) - Specifies the additional query options. Matches the \[PouchDB options syntax\]([https://pouchdb.com/api.html#query_index](https://pouchdb.com/api.html#query_index)).
    
    - **sort** (array) - Specifies the sorting criteria for the query.
        
    - **limit** (number) - Limits the number of results to be returned.
        
    - **skip** (number) - Specifies the number of results to skip.
        

Example:

``` json
{
  "filter": {
    "sourceApplication": "https://youtube.com/"
  },
  "sort": [
    {
      "_id": "desc"
    }
  ],
  "limit": 5,
  "skip": 0
}

 ```

#### Response

- **Status**: 200
    
- **Content-Type**: application/json
    
- **items** (array) - Contains the result items
    
- **limit** (integer) - Results per page
    
- **skip** (integer) - How many results to skip
    
- **dbCount** (integer) - Total records in the database (ignoring any filter)

response.name: Favourite Query

request.description:
### Watch a User Datastore

This endpoint allows you to make a POST request to watch a specific datastore containing user data. Any new (or modified) database records are returned in the stream.

A datastore is a database that is guaranteed to match a specific schema.

This is not a typical HTTP request, it uses `EventSource` to stream the database changes.

#### Request URL

The request URL is in the following format `/ds/watch/{testDsEncoded}`, where:

- **{testDsEncoded}**: Base64 encoded URL of the datastore schema (ie: `https://common.schemas.verida.io/social/chat/group/v0.1.0/schema.json` is encoded to `aHR0cHM6Ly9jb21tb24uc2NoZW1hcy52ZXJpZGEuaW8vc29jaWFsL2NoYXQvZ3JvdXAvdjAuMS4wL3NjaGVtYS5qc29u`).
    

#### Request Body

- **options** (object) - Specifies the additional query options. Matches the \[PouchDB options syntax for `changes`\]([https://pouchdb.com/api.html#changes](https://pouchdb.com/api.html#changes)).
    
    - **sort** (array) - Specifies the sorting criteria for the query.
        
    - **limit** (number) - Limits the number of results to be returned.
        
    - **skip** (number) - Specifies the number of results to skip.
        

Example:

``` json
{
  "options": {
    "descending": true
  }
}

 ```

#### Response

- **Status**: 200
    
- **Content-Type**: application/json
    
- **type** (string) - Type of event response. One of the following:
    
    - `record`: Full database record that has been inserted or modified
        
    - `complete`: Change log has been cancelled and is now complete
        
    - `error`: Error has occurred
        
- **value** (any) - Response value, which depends on the response `type`:
    
    - `record`: Object containing the inserted or modified database record
        
    - `complete`: Empty
        
    - `error`: String containing the error message

### Fetch a User Datastore Record

This endpoint allows you to make a GET request to fetch a specific datastore record containing user data.

A datastore is a database that is guaranteed to match a specific schema.

#### Request URL

The request URL is in the following format `/ds/query/{testDsEncoded}/{recordId}`, where:

- **{testDsEncoded}**: Base64 encoded URL of the datastore schema (ie: `https://common.schemas.verida.io/social/chat/group/v0.1.0/schema.json` is encoded to `aHR0cHM6Ly9jb21tb24uc2NoZW1hcy52ZXJpZGEuaW8vc29jaWFsL2NoYXQvZ3JvdXAvdjAuMS4wL3NjaGVtYS5qc29u`).
    
- **{recordId}**: The database record to fetch (ie: `google-114389302261538986945-xskZ50giJkw`)
    

### Request Body

This request does not require a request body.

### Headers

- **permissions**: Specify the permissions for the database that is being access. ie: `read=owner,write=owner`. You can typically leave this blank as the default permissions are configured to work for all private databases. See the `Fetch User Profile` example of a request that specifies custom database permissions.
    
- **key**: Private key or seed phrase of the Verida Network account being accessed
    

### Response Body

- **Status**: 200
    
- **Content-Type**: application/json
    
- **item** (object) - Contains the result item, if found
    

### Error Responses

If the requested database record is not found, the response will have a status code of 404 with an empty body.

If there is a server error, the response will have a status code of 5xx with a body containing a JSON object with an `error` message attribute.

request.description:
### GET /api/v1/admin/memory

This endpoint retrieves memory usage information for the server.

#### Request

No request body is required for this endpoint.

#### Response

The response will be a JSON object with the following properties:

- `rss` (number): Resident Set Size memory usage.
    
- `heapTotal` (number): Total heap memory usage.
    
- `heapUsed` (number): Used heap memory usage.
    
- `external` (number): Memory usage of Array buffers.
    
- `arrayBuffers` (number): Memory usage of Array buffers.
    

Example response:

``` json
{
    "rss": 0,
    "heapTotal": 0,
    "heapUsed": 0,
    "external": 0,
    "arrayBuffers": 0
}

 ```

Valid **providers**:

- `bedrock`
    
- `groq`
    
- `custom`
    

Valid **models** for **bedrock**:

- LLAMA3_70B
    
- LLAMA3_8B
    
- MIXTRAL_8_7B
    

Valid **models** for **groq**:

- LLAMA3_70B
    
- LLAMA31_70B
    
- LLAMA3_8B
    
- MIXTRAL8_7B

    "result": "\n\nBased on the provided messages, your last electricity bill was $409.47, which is stated in the email from Amber Electric dated August 19, 2024.",

    "process": {
        "search_type": "keywords",
        "keywords": [
            "electricity",
            "bill",
            "payment",
            "cost",
            "utility",
            "invoice"
        ],
        "timeframe": "month",
        "databases": [
            "emails",
            "files"
        ],
        "sort": "recent",
        "output_type": "summary",
        "profile_information": []
    }
}

}
